content.description:
Researchers tested infants whose first language was either English or Hindi. The researchers assessed the ability of these infants to distinguish between the /ta/ versus /Ta/ sounds in Hindi at various ages. The difference in these sounds is indistinguishable to adults who speak English only. The results of this study suggest that the ability to distinguish sounds in a language other than a person’s first language decreases with age.

content.question: Which of the following factors best represents an operational definition of the dependent variable?

choices.label: The age in months of the infants being tested
The infants whose first language is English
The /ta/ versus /Ta/ sounds presented to the infants
The percentage of infants capable of distinguishing between the /ta/ and /Ta/ sounds

content.answer: The percentage of infants capable of distinguishing between the /ta/ and /Ta/ sounds
